itemDescription: Professor of Ultrafast Physics and Technology at Imperial College London

wikipedia_page.main: (James) Roy Taylor (born 1949)  is Professor of Ultrafast Physics and Technology at Imperial College London.

link_mentions.page: Institute of Physics Michael Faraday Medal and Prize
response: * 2019 Roy Taylor, "For his extensive, internationally leading contributions to the development of spectrally diverse, ultrafast-laser sources and pioneering fundamental studies of nonlinear fibre optics that have translated to scientific and commercial application."
*Bert Taylor (footballer, born 1900) (1900–1980), known as Roy Taylor, Australian rules footballer
*Roy Taylor (historian), winner of the Julian Corbett Prize in Naval History 1954
*Roy Taylor (scientist), a physician and diabetologist at Newcastle University, United Kingdom
*Roy Taylor (tennis) (1883–1934), semifinalist in 1913 Australasian Championships – Singles and 1920 Australasian Championships – Singles
*J. Roy Taylor (born 1949), Professor of Physics at Imperial College London, recipient of Rumford Medal 2012
